ch.ethz.csb.youscope.client.addon.tool.scripting
Interface ScriptStyle

All Known Implementing Classes:
JavaScriptStyle, MatlabScriptStyle
public interface ScriptStyle

Definition of how a script is rendered. Should be implemented for each script language for which a specific rendering is wanted.

Author:
langmo

Method Summary
 java.lang.String getBlockCommentEndDelimiter()
          Returns the character sequence used in the language to end a block comment.
 java.lang.String getBlockCommentStartDelimiter()
          Returns the character sequence used in the language to start a block comment.
 java.lang.String getEscapeQuoteDelimiter(java.lang.String quoteDelimiter)
          Returns the string used to print the given quote delimiter inside a quote without stopping the quote (if quote delimiter is e.g. ", the escaped one might be \").
 java.lang.String[] getFileNameExtensions()
          Returns an array of all file name extensions typically associated with scripts for which this style is made.
 java.lang.String getSingleLineDelimiter()
          Returns the character sequence used in the language to start a single line comment.

Method Detail

isDelimiter

boolean isDelimiter(java.lang.String character)
Returns true if the given character delimits two words/commands (e.g. ".", ",", ";", ...)

Parameters:
character - The character for which it should be queried if it is a delimiter.
Returns:
True if character is a delimiter.

isQuoteDelimiter

boolean isQuoteDelimiter(java.lang.String character)
Returns true if the given character can be used to delimit a quote (e.g. " or ').

Parameters:
character - The character for which it should be queried if it is a quote delimiter.
Returns:
True if character is a quote delimiter.

isKeyword

boolean isKeyword(java.lang.String token)
Returns true if the given token is a language specific keyword (e.g. "global", "function", ...).

Parameters:
token -
Returns:
true if the token is a keyword.

getBlockCommentStartDelimiter

java.lang.String getBlockCommentStartDelimiter()
Returns the character sequence used in the language to start a block comment.

Returns:
Character sequence to start a block comment, or null if block comments do not exist in the language.

getBlockCommentEndDelimiter

java.lang.String getBlockCommentEndDelimiter()
Returns the character sequence used in the language to end a block comment.

Returns:
Character sequence to end a block comment, or null if block comments do not exist in the language.

getSingleLineDelimiter

java.lang.String getSingleLineDelimiter()
Returns the character sequence used in the language to start a single line comment.

Returns:
Character sequence to start a single line comment, or null if single line comments do not exist in the language.

getEscapeQuoteDelimiter

java.lang.String getEscapeQuoteDelimiter(java.lang.String quoteDelimiter)
Returns the string used to print the given quote delimiter inside a quote without stopping the quote (if quote delimiter is e.g. ", the escaped one might be \").

Parameters:
quoteDelimiter - The escaped version of the quote delimiter.
Returns:
the escaped quote delimiter, or null if not existing.

getFileNameExtensions

java.lang.String[] getFileNameExtensions()
Returns an array of all file name extensions typically associated with scripts for which this style is made.

Returns:
List of typical file extensions.

supportsFileNameExtension

boolean supportsFileNameExtension(java.lang.String extension)
Returns true if the given file name extension is typically associated with scripts for which this style is made.

Parameters:
extension -
Returns:
true if this extension is typically for script files of this type.
